title: Homemade Cheese
summary: Fresh, creamy cheese made using traditional Cretan methods.

items: 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice or white vinegar

instructions.value: Pour milk into a large pot and heat over medium heat, stirring occasionally to prevent scorching.
When milk reaches 185°F (85°C) or just before boiling, remove from heat.
Add lemon juice or vinegar and stir gently. The milk will begin to curdle immediately.
Let stand for 10 minutes. You'll see clear separation between curds and whey.
Line a colander with cheesecloth and place over a large bowl. Pour the mixture through to strain.
Gather the corners of the cheesecloth and rinse the curds under cold water.
Squeeze out excess liquid, add salt, and mix gently.
Tie the cheesecloth into a bundle and hang over a bowl for 2-3 hours to drain completely.
Unwrap and enjoy fresh, or refrigerate in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

tips_and_notes: Use the freshest whole milk possible for the best flavor
The whey can be saved and used in baking or for making ricotta
For a firmer cheese, press under a weight while draining
